title: Fani Willis
content:
{{short description|American attorney, and District Attorney of Fulton County}} {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2021}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Fani Willis | office = [[District Attorney]] of [[Fulton County, Georgia|Fulton County]] | term_start = January 1, 2021 | term_end = | predecessor = Paul Howard | successor = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1971|10|27}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles, California]] | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] | education = [[Howard University]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])
[[Emory University]] ([[Juris Doctor|JD]]) }} '''Fani Taifa Willis'''{{Cite web|url=https://southatlantamagazine.com/2021/01/20/fultoncountyda/|title=You Can Call Her Madam DA; Fani Willis on Making History As Fulton County's First Woman District Attorney|date=January 20, 2021|work=South Atlanta Magazine|first=Ashtin|last=Rose}} ({{Respell|FAH|nee}}, born October 27, 1971) is an American attorney from the [[U.S. state|state]] of [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]. She is the [[district attorney]] of [[Fulton County, Georgia]], which contains most of [[Atlanta]].{{Cite news|last1=Murphy|first1=Patricia|last2=Bluestein|first2=Greg|last3=Mitchell|first3=Tia|date=February 12, 2021|title=The Jolt: Fani Willis takes center stage in the Trump show|work=[[Atlanta Journal Constitution]]|url=https://www.ajc.com/politics/politics-blog/the-jolt-fani-willis-takes-center-stage-in-trump-show/3GHH7FS3FFAY3NVJ23YB2L3PIQ/|access-date=February 13, 2021}} She is the first woman to hold the office of Fulton County district attorney.{{cite web |title=Fani T. Willis, Fulton County District Attorney |url=https://fultoncountyga.gov/inside-fulton-county/fulton-county-departments/district-attorney/da-executive-team/fani-willis |publisher=Fulton County Government |access-date=15 May 2022 |date=2022}} ==Biography== Willis graduated from [[Howard University]] and [[Emory University School of Law]]. She spent 16 years as a prosecutor in the [[Fulton County, Georgia|Fulton County]] [[district attorney]]'s office. Her most prominent case was her prosecution of the [[Atlanta Public Schools cheating scandal]]. In 2018, she went into private practice.{{Cite news|last=Umontuen|first=Itoro|date=August 12, 2020|title=Fani Willis will become the next Fulton County DA, beating six-term incumbent Paul Howard|work=The Atlanta Voice|url=https://www.theatlantavoice.com/articles/fani-willis-beats-six-term-incumbent-paul-howard/|access-date=February 13, 2021}} That year, she ran for a seat on the Fulton County Superior Court, and lost.{{Cite news|last=Catts|first=Everett|date=April 16, 2020|title=Howard, Smith and Willis warring for Fulton's district attorney post|work=The Neighbor|url=https://www.mdjonline.com/neighbor_newspapers/howard-smith-and-willis-warring-for-fultons-district-attorney-post/article_4acb1ba2-7fc0-11ea-8877-03d0c39dee2c.html|access-date=February 13, 2021}} In 2020, Willis was elected district attorney for Fulton County, defeating Paul Howard, a six-term incumbent and her former boss.{{Cite news|last=Boone|first=Christian|date=August 14, 2020|title=After historic victory, Fani Willis plans transformation of Fulton DA's office|work=[[Atlanta Journal Constitution]]|url=https://www.ajc.com/news/crime/after-historic-victory-fani-willis-plans-transformation-of-fulton-das-office/ESMGVJXELBFPRDC2NBXSLJAGSU/|access-date=February 13, 2021}}{{Cite news|last=McDonald|first=R. Robin|date=August 11, 2020|title=Fani Willis Sweeps Paul Howard to Take Over as Fulton County DA|work=[[Law.com]]|url=https://www.law.com/dailyreportonline/2020/08/11/fani-willis-sweeps-paul-howard-to-take-over-as-fulton-county-da/?slreturn=20210113085551|access-date=February 13, 2021}} ==2020 election influence investigation== On February 10, 2021, Willis launched a criminal investigation into [[Donald Trump]]'s attempts to influence Georgia election officials—including the [[Governor of Georgia|governor]], the [[Attorney General of Georgia|attorney general]], and [[Georgia Secretary of State|Secretary of State]] [[Brad Raffensperger]] via [[Trump–Raffensperger phone call|a telephone call]]—to "find" enough votes to override [[Joe Biden]]'s win in that state and thus [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|undo Biden's victory]] in the [[U.S. presidential election, 2020|2020 presidential election]] .{{cite web |last1=Hakim |first1=Danny |last2=Fausset |first2=Richard |date=February 13, 2021 |title=In Georgia, a New District Attorney Starts Circling Trump and His Allies |work=[[The New York Times]] |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/13/us/politics/fani-willis-trump.html |accessdate=February 13, 2021}}{{cite news|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/02/10/politics/trump-georgia-criminal-investigation-election/index.html|title=Prosecutors in Georgia open criminal investigation into Trump's attempt to influence election results|last1=Morris|first1=Jason|last2=Cole|first2=Devan|date=February 10, 2021|work=[[CNN]]|accessdate=February 12, 2021}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/10/us/politics/trump-georgia-investigation.html|title=Georgia Prosecutors Open Criminal Inquiry Into Trump's Efforts to Subvert Election|last1=Fausset|first1=Richard|last2=Hakim|first2=Danny|date=February 10, 2021|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=February 12, 2021}} In January 2022, she requested a [[special jury|special]] [[grand jury]] to consider charges of election interference by Trump and his allies.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/06/us/politics/trump-election-interference-investigation.html|title=Georgia Grand Jury Looms in Trump Inquiry|last1=Hakim|first1=Danny|last2=Fausset|first2=Richard|date=November 6, 2021|work=[[The New York Times]]|access-date=7 November 2021}}{{cite news|url=https://www.ajc.com/news/atlanta-news/breaking-fulton-da-requests-special-grand-jury-for-trump-probe/E5HCDM2P75ETRAEUHBK2Q7L3FY/|title=Fulton DA requests special grand jury for Trump probe|work=[[Atlanta Journal-Constitution]]|first=Tamar|last=Hallerman|date=20 January 2022|accessdate=20 January 2022}} A 26-member special grand jury was given investigative authority and [[Subpoena|subpoena power]] and tasked with submitting a report to the judge and Willis on whether a crime was committed.{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/05/02/politics/grand-jury-fulton-county-georgia-trump-election/index.html|title=Grand jury selected in Fulton County probe of Trump election interference in Georgia|work=[[CNN]]|first1=Sara|last1=Murray|first2=Jason|last2=Morris|date=2 May 2022|accessdate=2 May 2022}} Willis sent [[target letter]]s to people she is investigating related to the [[Trump fake electors plot|fake electors plot]]. These include two Republican officials — State Senator [[Brandon Beach]] and [[David Shafer (politician)|David Shafer]], chairman of the [[Georgia Republican Party]]{{cite news |last1=Fausset |first1=Richard |last2=Hakim |first2=Danny |date=July 15, 2022 |title=Prosecutor Warns Georgia Officials They May Face Charges in Trump Inquiry: The investigation could prove to be one of the most perilous legal problems facing the former president and his allies. |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/07/15/us/georgia-investigation-trump.html |accessdate=July 15, 2022}} — and the 16 people who falsely presented themselves as [[United States Electoral College|electors]].{{Cite web |last=Visser |first=Nick |date=July 20, 2022 |title=Fake Electors Are Now 'Targets' In Georgia Probe Of Trump's Effort To Overturn 2020 Vote |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/georgia-fake-electors-considered-targets-georgia-investigation_n_62d76c8ee4b000da23f91f8f |access-date=July 20, 2022 |website=[[Huffington Post]] |language=en}} She also sent a target letter to State Senator [[Burt Jones]], but then a judge said she could not target Jones due to a conflict of interest.{{Cite web |last=Mangan |first=Dan |date=25 July 2022 |title=Georgia prosecutor Fani Willis disqualified from investigating Trump 'fake elector' in criminal probe |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2022/07/25/georgia-prosecutor-fani-willis-barred-from-investigating-trump-fake-elector.html |access-date=August 19, 2022 |website=[[CNBC]] |language=en}} Former US Sen. Kelly Loeffler and former White House Counsel Pat Cipollone testified.{{Cite web |last=Murray |first=Sara |last2=Cohen |first2=Zachary |last3=Perez |first3=Evan |date=2022-10-20 |title=First on CNN: Former White House Counsel Pat Cipollone, former US Sen. Kelly Loeffler testify to grand jury in Georgia investigating 2020 election interference {{!}} CNN Politics |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/10/20/politics/kelly-loeffler-pat-cipollone-georgia-special-grand-jury/index.html |access-date=2022-10-20 |website=CNN |language=en}} In August 2022, [[Sidney Powell]] was asked to appear due to her involvement in arranging for the collection of data from the voting machines and systems at the county’s elections office in rural [[Coffee County, Georgia|Coffee County]] in January 2021.{{Cite news |date=August 26, 2022 |title=Trump election probe in Georgia cites voting system breach |language=en |agency=[[Associated Press]] |url=https://apnews.com/article/2022-midterm-elections-voting-donald-trump-georgia-6c5483c82b47cf402136b39e72326309 |access-date=August 27, 2022}} {| class="wikitable" |+Subpoenas !Name !Role !Subpoenaed !Testified !Notes |- |[[Rudy Giuliani]] |member of Trump's legal team |July 5, 2022{{Cite news |last=Brown |first=Matthew |date=5 July 2022 |title=Georgia grand jury subpoenas Sen. Graham, Giuliani and Trump legal team |newspaper=Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/07/05/georgia-grand-jury-subpoenas-sen-graham-giuliani-trump-legal-team/ |access-date=6 July 2022}} |August 17, 2022 |Giuliani was told on August 15, two days before he testified before the special grand jury, that he was a target of the investigation.{{Cite news |last1=Brown |first1=Matthew |last2=Hamburger |first2=Tom |date=17 August 2022 |title=Giuliani appears before Georgia grand jury in probe of efforts to overturn 2020 election |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/08/17/giuliani-georgia-grand-jury/ |access-date=17 August 2022}}{{Cite web |last1=Murray |first1=Sara |last2=Morris |first2=Jason |date=15 August 2022 |title=Giuliani told he is a target in Georgia 2020 presidential election probe |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/08/15/politics/rudy-giuliani-georgia-presidential-election-probe/index.html |access-date=2022-08-15 |website=[[CNN]]}}{{Cite news |last1=Wagner |first1=John |last2=Alfaro |first2=Mariana |date=20 July 2022 |title=Biden to deliver climate ultimatum; House panel to weigh assault weapons ban |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/07/20/biden-climate-house-assault-weapons/#link-5JJFUPNIUNEFNOLCUXUL2MAJOU |access-date=20 July 2022}}{{Cite web |last=Brumback |first=Kate |date=August 9, 2022 |title=Judge Orders Giuliani To Testify In Atlanta Election Probe |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/judge-orders-giuliani-atlanta-election_n_62f2b63ae4b001e175d85377 |access-date=2022-08-09 |website=[[Huffington Post]] |language=en}} |- |Kenneth Chesebro |member of Trump's legal team |July 5, 2022 | | |- |[[John Eastman]] |member of Trump's legal team |July 5, 2022 |August 31, 2022{{Cite web |last=Visser |first=Nick |date=September 1, 2022 |title=John Eastman, Key Figure In Fake Elector Plot, Appears Before Atlanta Grand Jury |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/john-eastman-atlanta-grand-jury_n_6310523ae4b063d5e621b249 |access-date=2022-09-01 |website=[[Huffington Post]] |language=en}} | |- |[[Jenna Ellis]] |member of Trump's legal team |July 5, 2022 |August 25, 2022 (probable){{Cite web |last=King |first=Ryan |date=August 26, 2022 |title=Former Trump campaign lawyer Jenna Ellis testified before Fulton County inquiry: Report |url=https://gazette.com/news/us-world/former-trump-campaign-lawyer-jenna-ellis-testified-before-fulton-county-inquiry-report/article_4a45adcc-39dd-5eee-b7fd-0346b2bd0ccb.html |access-date=September 1, 2022 |website=[[Colorado Springs Gazette]] |language=en}} | |- |[[Cleta Mitchell]] |member of Trump's legal team |July 5, 2022 | | |- |[[Lindsey Graham]] |U.S. Senator |July 5, 2022 |November 22, 2022{{Cite web |last=Murray |first=Sara |last2=Youd |first2=Chris |date=2022-11-22 |title=Lindsey Graham testifies before Georgia grand jury investigating 2020 election aftermath |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/11/22/politics/lindsey-graham-fulton-county-grand-jury-2020-election/index.html |access-date=2022-11-22 |website=CNN Politics |language=en}} |Though Graham objected to the subpoena, it was upheld by a federal judge,{{Cite news |last=Scott |first=Eugene |date=15 August 2022 |title=Graham must testify in Ga. probe of effort to overturn 2020 election, judge rules |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/08/15/trump-2020-election-georgia-investigation/ |access-date=15 August 2022}}{{Cite web |last=Brumback |first=Kate |date=August 19, 2022 |title=Judge Won't Let Graham Delay Testimony In Election Probe |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/lindsey-graham-election-probe-georgia_n_62ffea49e4b035629bfaf91d |access-date=2022-08-20 |website=[[Huffington Post]] |language=en}} then by an appeals court,{{Cite web |last=Brumback |first=Kate |date=August 21, 2022 |title=Court Puts On Hold Lindsey Graham's Testimony In Georgia Election Probe |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/court-hold-lindsey-graham-georgia-election-investigation_n_630255a8e4b0f7df9bb14c06 |access-date=August 21, 2022 |website=[[Huffington Post]] |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=Sneed |first=Tierney |date=2022-10-20 |title=Atlanta investigators can subpoena Lindsey Graham in 2020 election investigation, federal appeals court rules {{!}} CNN Politics |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/10/20/politics/lindsey-graham-georgia-subpoena/index.html |access-date=2022-10-20 |website=CNN |language=en}} then by the Supreme Court.{{Cite web |date=2022-10-24 |title=Justice Thomas Temporarily Blocks Graham Testimony In Georgia |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/georgia-election-investigation_n_6356c899e4b0b7f89f64949b |access-date=2022-10-24 |website=HuffPost |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=de Vogue |first=Ariane |last2=Murray |first2=Sara |last3=Sneed |first3=Tierney |date=2022-11-01 |title=Supreme Court rejects Lindsey Graham's request to block Georgia grand jury subpoena {{!}} CNN Politics |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/11/01/politics/lindsey-graham-supreme-court/index.html |access-date=2022-11-01 |website=CNN |language=en}} |- |Jacki Pick Deason |former Capitol Hill counsel |July 5, 2022 |N/A |A Texas court said Deason does not have to testify.{{Cite web |last=Murray |first=Sara |last2=Morris |first2=Jason |date=7 September 2022 |title=Texas lawyer wins subpoena fight against Georgia prosecutors investigating Trump's efforts to overturn 2020 election |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/09/07/politics/georgia-2020-grand-jury-jacki-pick-deason/index.html |access-date=September 8, 2022 |website=[[CNN]]}} |- |[[Brian Kemp]] |Governor of Georgia |August 4, 2022{{Cite web |last1=Cheney |first1=Kyle |last2=Wu |first2=Nicholas |date=17 August 2022 |title=Kemp fights subpoena from Atlanta-area Trump probe after talks break down |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2022/08/17/kemp-fights-subpoena-willis-trump-probe-00052588 |access-date=August 19, 2022 |website=[[Politico]] |language=en}} |November 15, 2022{{cite web|last=Johnson|first=Kevin|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2022/11/15/georgia-governor-brian-kemp-testifies-grand-jury/10700783002/|title=Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp appears before Atlanta grand jury in election probe|work=[[USA Today]]|date=November 15, 2022|accessdate=November 15, 2022}} | |- |[[Mark Meadows]] |former White House chief of staff | | |A South Carolina court said Meadows must testify.{{Cite web |last=Sneed |first=Tierney |date=2022-10-26 |title=Mark Meadows ordered by court to testify in Georgia 2020 election meddling probe {{!}} CNN Politics |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/10/26/politics/mark-meadows-georgia-election-grand-jury/index.html |access-date=2022-10-26 |website=CNN |language=en}} |- |[[Michael Flynn]] |former national security adviser | |December 8, 2022{{Cite web |last=Morris |first=Jason |last2=Fiegel |first2=Eric |date=2022-12-08 |title=Michael Flynn appears before Atlanta grand jury probe into Trump's election subversion |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/12/08/politics/michael-flynn-atlanta-grand-jury-testimony-election-probe/index.html |access-date=2022-12-08 |website=CNN Politics |language=en}} |A Florida court said Flynn must testify.{{Cite web |last=Morris |first=Jason |last2=Sneed |first2=Tierney |date=2022-11-15 |title=Michael Flynn ordered to testify in Atlanta grand jury probe into Trump's election subversion |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/11/15/politics/michael-flynn-grand-jury/index.html |access-date=2022-11-16 |website=CNN Politics |language=en}} |} ==Atlanta gang indictments== In May 2022, Willis' office indicted [[Young Thug]] for 56 counts of gang-related crimes under Georgia's [[Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act|RICO]] statute and felony charges for possession of illicit firearms and drugs that were allegedly discovered after a search warrant was executed. The rapper has been held in [[Cobb County]] jail since his arrest.{{cite news |last1=Staten |first1=Adam |title=Young Thug's 'Torturous' Jail Condition Complaints Dismissed by Officials |url=https://www.newsweek.com/young-thugs-torturous-jail-condition-complaints-dismissed-officials-georgia-1707816 |access-date=18 May 2022 |work=[[Newsweek]] |date=18 May 2022}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Willis, Fani}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:District attorneys in Georgia (U.S. state)]] [[Category:African-American women lawyers]] [[Category:African-American lawyers]] [[Category:African-American women in politics]] [[Category:American prosecutors]] [[Category:Howard University alumni]] [[Category:Emory University School of Law alumni]] [[Category:21st-century African-American people]] [[Category:21st-century African-American women]]
